summary: An email chain from July to September 2021 regarding outreach to and coordination with a person identified as Ghislaine Maxwell's former assistant, who may have information for the prosecution. The emails involve FBI agents and NYPD personnel discussing scheduling an interview and the creation of an FBI 302 report.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the prosecution; her former assistant is being contacted for information.

events.title: Initial Contact from Maxwell's Assistant
events.description: A person identifying as Ghislaine Maxwell's former assistant reaches out to law enforcement, stating "I may have info that can help this prosecution."

events.title: Connection Made with Witness
events.description: An FBI Special Agent reports having connected with Maxwell's former assistant and schedules a conversation for the following night.

events.title: Interview Notes and 302 Prepared
events.description: An agent confirms speaking with the witness, has notes and emails, and states the FBI 302 report is written and awaiting serialization.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's former assistant proactively contacted law enforcement in July 2021, offering information to aid the prosecution.
The email chain shows coordination between the U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY), FBI New York Field Office (Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking squad), and NYPD regarding this witness.
By September 22, 2021, an interview had been conducted, notes and emails were collected, and an FBI 302 report was drafted and awaiting final processing.
The document references the creation of a new "witness folder" and "NTW 3500" for this individual, indicating formal intake into the investigative record.
